title.narrative: NACA/FAO Regional Resource Centre Diagnostic Training

description.narrative: The Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) in collaboration with the Network of Aquaculture Centres in Asia-Pacific (NACA) has developed the Asia Regional Technical Guidelines on Health Management for the Responsible Movement of Live Aquatic Animals. The expansion and diversification of the sector, along with globalisation and trade liberalisation have resulted in aquatic animals and animal products moving around the world rapidly, causing serious disease outbreaks stemming from incursions of pathogens through unregulated trans boundary movements. The Western Australian Department of Fisheries is working with Vietnamese counterparts to provide opportunities for experienced staff to undertake diagnostic experience in Australian laboratory relevant to the movement of aquatic animals.
